channel.title: My maps
channel.description:
Hello. I think this is right place for advertising :p Few maps of mine : [url]https://www.youtube.com/user/lauris47#grid/user/09087E675C31C7F6[/url] Hardest work was chernobyl/abandoned : [url]https://img708.imageshack.us/img708/9947/hl22010050713215016.jpg[/url] [url]https://img11.imageshack.us/img11/36/hl22010050713213530.jpg[/url] [url]https://img534.imageshack.us/img534/18/hl22010050713211013.jpg[/url] [url]https://img340.imageshack.us/img340/1310/hl22010050713204045.jpg[/url] [url]https://img208.imageshack.us/img208/1267/hl22010050713200143.jpg[/url] [url]https://img203.imageshack.us/img203/7848/hl22010050713192652.jpg[/url] [url]https://img195.imageshack.us/img195/3228/hl22010041618425705.png[/url] And video of it : [url]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=K9jly-XYV3M[/url] There is download link also : [url]https://www.megaupload.com/?d=TRN7NAYV[/url] BUT IT IS LAGGY, I tried hard to optimize this map and I thing done everything what is possible.
Thanks for watching !

item.title: My maps
item.dc:creator: Fnoigy
item.description:
I’m not sure it really mattered, I couldn’t even tell what he was saying.

Read full topic

item.title: My maps
item.dc:creator: lauris47
item.description:
I understand.
but, it is “open” map + there is building and giant antenna from witch you can see far, so I added heavy fog to hide real world and 3d skybox fake world differences. And more, as default skybox 3d doesn’t uses nor fog nor fog blend dir and so on. so to make skybox and real world fog work together as one was pain in the ass. It concludes fog start and end counting + the beginning and end fog of fake world , and plus scale… it is just mess. I had to recompile map for tenths of time to get it right.
Then, I used different grass textures in 3d skybox to bypass displacements limits.There is even “fake grass” in the real world. Then, the world is wast so I had to use big brushes- there is limits for that too. and if make more but smaller then you’ll reach another limits of source… then, it is impossible to put so many polygons in source engine on one map, and remember that this is multiplayer. as sample you can pick one white antenna part and it will be enough to break source limits, no bullshit. So to bypass poligons limits I converted heavy constructions to models, and that gave better performance. as for performance I used ocluder, brush to model, area portal, prop load distance, and “your fog”. also I done trick by adding “model walls” in map, because pc won’t load anything in front of that wall. it won’t happen with normal brush/detail … skip and hint won’t work in multi… then if you notice 9 or so flours building is orientated not straight. That will cause to reaching another source limits… I could talk for ages on this one. it took me 8 months. it may look not worth, but as for my self i’m glad that I finished it. I care about of other opinion just a bit.
So what is done is done.
Fog color, yes you are right, unrealistic when sky is like that ;D
I made it kind of blue because it looks more “anomaly” to me. we talking about chernobyl, right…

Fnoigy:

Honestly, you should either have fog, OR have a skybox. However, when you have both, it just looks weird how buildings turn to gray in front of an orange and purple sky.

If you’re going for heavy fog, then don’t have an actual skybox, but rather have the sky be more or less the same color as the fog (since the sky, theoretically, is being obscured by the same vapor that is obscuring objects as you move away from them).

If you’re just going for the natural haze you see over greatly distant objects, then make it be the same color as the sky, and ONLY start to become noticeable as you get REALLY far away from something.

Read full topic

item.title: My maps
item.dc:creator: Fnoigy
item.description:
Honestly, you should either have fog, OR have a skybox. However, when you have both, it just looks weird how buildings turn to gray in front of an orange and purple sky.

If you’re going for heavy fog, then don’t have an actual skybox, but rather have the sky be more or less the same color as the fog (since the sky, theoretically, is being obscured by the same vapor that is obscuring objects as you move away from them).

If you’re just going for the natural haze you see over greatly distant objects, then make it be the same color as the sky, and ONLY start to become noticeable as you get REALLY far away from something.

item.title: My maps
item.dc:creator: Door
item.description:
The ‘abandoned’ map’s fog has been niggling at me all day; it looks far too thick and the colour is a tad saturated.

Read full topic

item.title: My maps
item.dc:creator: lauris47
item.description:
Ye I know man, critics makes things better, but if creator wants to.
I’m just making fun I’m not offended in any way. + this map is past.
I could explain all thing why my map look like it is now
(bad lighting on some props, lag, some texture mistmatched blending…) but it is long story.
If keep things simple it is because of source limits in earlier version of engine.
2009 tools works better, but still everything is limited, man.

Thanks for watching.

jethrosoup:

There are some things about your map I like, but, in order to succeed in creating, you gotta learn how to take criticism, man.

Read full topic

item.title: My maps
item.dc:creator: lauris47
item.description:
Thanks, fixed.

ManlyStump:

For anyone interested in the images, take the “.th” out of the file names to view the full size version rather than the thumbnail. And there’s an anomalous “]” at the end of the last image

Is this one is better ? : https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jND4btigxAU

Patonki:

There is a thin line between bleak and boring.
Take a look at how the buildings in pripyat correspond each-other, don’t just slap some russian building in there by random. Why is there a lonely apartment block building there by itself, etc.

I know man. I tried to fix this but. but.
This map is for multiplayer and I couldn’t use optimization tools like in singleplayer, because they don’t work… blame source.
I don’t expect to see if someone playing this map in multiplayer…
created just to for lil fun…

ashton93:

It laggs

Read full topic
